comment:
Attend lectures, he'll bring up very specific examples that pop up in the midterm & final. 
Extra credit if you answer a question in class. Very entertaining, passionate.
Occasional short response homework, mini quizzes. All take-home/online. 
Midterm & final open note, no time limit. If you have a high enough grade, you can skip the final.

I wouldn't take him for a survey of history, he made his tests literally so hard for no reason and they were so specific based on his lectures that would be an hour + long. He DOESNTTTTT respond to emails and he is very sensitive, has anger issues. Take someone else unless you wanna spend countless hours on a class that should be a very easy A!!

There was reading quizzes or critical thinking questions due every Monday. There were few in class assignments but they weren't hard. For attendance, he does QR codes at the beginning of class. Take good notes (I highly recommend recording the lesson on a word doc because the midterm and final are only based specific parts of on the notes.)

While he may sorta some off abrasive or intimidating at first, he is a really nice teacher. He will get upset if you are on your phone in class (which is reasonable), but his passion in his lectures make the class easy to digest. He does have in-class assignments that do require your attendance, but it's easy. Every test I took was online.

Professor Nichols is extremely strict in his class. If we didn't answer a question in under 5 seconds, he would grow very mad. He is very passionate about history but has some anger issues. His class is so early and long. If you walk in 3 minutes late, he will death stare you and probably comment. Take another professor if possible.
Amazing professor and extremely knowledgeable! As long as you turn in all your work, pay attention 70% of the time in class and show up you will get an easy 100!

I normally never leave reviews, but Professor Nichols truly deserves recognition. He is not only an incredible historian but also one of the most caring and understanding professors I have ever had. His passion for history makes every lecture engaging, and he genuinely wants his students to succeed.

Great teacher ! You must go to class to get the notes for the exams ! There were critical thinking questions or a quiz every week! The quizzes and critical thinking questions does not relate to test so go to class for notes ! 9/10 will receive a 100 on all critical thinking questions as long as they are turned in .. Overall good teacher

I loved how he spoke and how, during his lectures, you could tell he was interested in the topic. His online tests aren't proctored and are pretty simple. My best advice would be to write all of your notes into a Word document and include the QR code activities that he does because those are exam questions. just show up to class!
Gives in class assignments sometimes, weekly assignment whether a quiz or critical thinking questions, midterm and final are based on the content from lectures. Can exempt from final.

Loved this professor! One reading quiz or critical thinking question assignment a week. No tests. Sometimes surprise in class assignments and online questions almost every class so make sure you attend all lectures. Does not take late work or excuses after absence. Very passionate about this course and its material. Just follow directions.

Definitely very lecture heavy, i found it easiest to record lectures and go back and listen while doing other things as well. He has very clear expectations and is very fair in grading/absences/etc. He doesn't take attendance but he does in class assignments occasionally that do count and you can't make up. You can tell he really cares!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: The lectures are great and actually teach you things. He revisits subjects so you don't forget things. He actually wants you to learn.

Prof. Nichols is a great teacher! His lectures are very interesting to listen to but I find it very hard to take notes just from him talking. He does not provide ppts with words or important material just pictures. I like my notes concise but, I find myself losing where I was in sentence as I type. This class was hard for me just for that reason.

He was amazing he made the lecture more entertaining as someone who does not like history. He gave some extra credit opportunities. We had one assignment a week which was either an open-note reading quiz or critical thinking questions. Only one exam which is the final cumulative exam.
